block.p: Elizabeth Jane Wohlken, the daughter of Francine Lucas of Seattle and Norman J. Wohlken of Sea Ranch, Calif., was married yesterday to Christopher Sanford Rugaber, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Rugaber of Roanoke, Va. The Rev. Penelope M. Bridges performed the ceremony at Grace Episcopal Church in Alexandria, Va.

Mrs. Rugaber, 28, completed her first year of law school at Georgetown University in May. She graduated from Smith College. Her father retired as the marketing director at Security Pacific National Bank, which was in Los Angeles. Her mother is an agent for Windermere Real Estate in Seattle, where she is also a practitioner of interior feng shui, the Asian art of harmonious arrangement. The bride is a stepdaughter of Martha S. Wohlken.

Elizabeth Jane Wohlken, the daughter of Francine Lucas of Seattle and Norman J. Wohlken of Sea Ranch, Calif., was married yesterday to Christopher Sanford Rugaber, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Rugaber of Roanoke, Va. The Rev. Penelope M. Bridges performed the ceremony at Grace Episcopal Church in Alexandria, Va.

Mrs. Rugaber, 28, completed her first year of law school at Georgetown University in May. She graduated from Smith College. Her father retired as the marketing director at Security Pacific National Bank, which was in Los Angeles. Her mother is an agent for Windermere Real Estate in Seattle, where she is also a practitioner of interior feng shui, the Asian art of harmonious arrangement. The bride is a stepdaughter of Martha S. Wohlken.

Mr. Rugaber, 31, is an editor and a writer in Alexandria at the Motley Fool, the personal finance Web site. He graduated from Dickinson College and received a master's degree in political science from American University. His father is the president and publisher of The Roanoke Times.
